text:
Hello!
I am trying to invoke get access token api from localhost:3000  <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/token> it giving me 200Ok but response does not contain anyting
Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8>! It seems to be working in the live environment, but not when running from localhost.

Hello, I have a pretty advanced usecase for the HubSpot Chat Bot:
1. I want to pass in a variable (`companyId`) when I activate the Chat Bot.
2. Inside my chat flow, I’m gonna call a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/webhooks-in-bots|custom webhook> that I’ve built, where this `companyId` becomes important.
Can I use `_hsq.push(["identify"], { ... })` (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/tracking-code|docs>) for this? Can’t see that the `companyId` is available in the webhook request.
interesting! glad it is working for you
There’s something called `customPayload` in the HubSpot webhook payload (both on root level and in `module.config.customPayload`) but have no idea how to set this.

There’s also `customState` which is <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/code-snippets-in-bots|mentioned here> and apparently works for webhooks too, but it’s only carries information from external webhook back into the chat.

Hi there,
I created a CRM Card which updates the deal’s line items.
I’d like to “refresh” the deal view when the CRM Card’s iframe is closing.
Is there a way to achieve this ?
